meanings.definition: To bother or annoy someone persistently.
meanings.sent1: The buzzing mosquito continued to toze me all night long.
meanings.sent2: Stop tozing your little sister, she's getting upset.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten would toze the dog by batting its tail.
meanings.sent4: The dripping faucet seemed to toze the homeowner with its constant noise.
meanings.sent5: The persistent salesperson would toze customers until they made a purchase.

meanings.definition: To tease or make fun of someone.
meanings.sent1: The children would toze each other playfully during recess.
meanings.sent2: It's not nice to toze someone about their appearance.
meanings.sent3: The comedian liked to toze the audience with his witty jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her friends would toze her about her fear of spiders.
meanings.sent5: The siblings would toze each other with silly pranks.

meanings.definition: To pull or twist something tightly.
meanings.sent1: She had to toze the rope to secure the boat to the dock.
meanings.sent2: Toze the lid of the jar to open it more easily.
meanings.sent3: He tried to toze the stubborn cork out of the bottle.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic had to toze the bolt to loosen it.
meanings.sent5: Toze the fabric gently to avoid tearing it.
